verses.roman:
purāṇa-saṁhitām etām
aśrauṣma bhavato vayam
yasyāṁ khalūttamaḥ-śloko
bhagavān anavarṇyate

synonyms: purāṇa-saṁhitām—essential summary of all the Purāṇas; etām—this; aśrauṣma—have heard; bhavataḥ—from you; vayam—we; yasyām—in which; khalu—indeed; uttamaḥ-ślokaḥ—who is always described in choice poetry; bhagavān—the Personality of Godhead; anuvarṇyate—is fittingly described.
translation: I have heard from you this Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam, which is the perfect summary of all the Purāṇas and which perfectly describes the Supreme Lord, Uttamaḥśloka.
